channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Senate panel focuses on mental health concerns
item.description: Recognizing the importance of mental health amidst the coronavirus disease 2019 outbreak, Sen. Bong Go presided over a committee hearing to tackle Senate Bill 1471 that seeks to amend Republic Act 11036 or the Mental Health Act.

item.title: Business leaders, ex-health chiefs back GCQ
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Presidential Adviser for Entrepreneurship Joey Concepcion, Jaime Augusto Zobel de Ayala, chairman and CEO of Ayala Corp. along with former health secretaries Dr. Esperanza Cabral and Rep. Janette Garin, as well as Rep. Sharon Garin back President Duterte’s order to place Metro Manila under general community quarantine starting June 1.

item.title: DOH modifies daily COVID-19 case reporting
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: To give a clearer picture of the coronavirus disease 2019 situation in the country, the Department of Health (DOH) modified its daily reporting of cases starting yesterday.?

item.title: 2-phase resumption of public transport bared
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: Resumption of public land transport in areas under general community quarantine starting Monday – including Metro Manila – will be done in two phases.

item.title: Duterte OKs alternative learning strategy
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: After saying he would not allow students to go to school if a vaccine for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is not yet available, President Duterte has given his nod to the resumption of classes via alternative means of learning by August.

item.title: Qualified households to still get SAP under GCQ
item.description: All qualified beneficiaries of the social amelioration program living in areas categorized under modified enhanced community quarantine from May 16 to 31 are still included in the government’s cash relief package, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. said yesterday.

item.title: Hyun Bin grateful for Smart move
item.author: Joanne Rae M. Ramirez
item.description: Hyun Bin, who played the gallant and valiant North Korean army officer Capt. Ri Jeong Hyeok in the blockbuster K-Drama “Crash Landing on You,” is happy with his Smart move.

item.title: PNP set to conduct more mobile checkpoints
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The Philippine National Police will conduct more mobile checkpoints next week as Metro Manila transitions to a more lenient general community quarantine by June 1.

item.title: Duterte wants special powers extended
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: President Duterte will certify as urgent the proposal to extend the effectivity of the Bayanihan to Heal as One Act, which gives him special powers to address the coronavirus disease 2019

item.title: Philippines logs 1,046 additional cases as total infections reach 16,634
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: (Update 1, 10:12 p.m.) The Department of Health logged 1,046 additional infections Friday. Of the figure, only 46 were “fresh” cases and while 1,000 were “late” cases.
